page.title: 15FARM SURVEY, THWAITES (1)
page.content: We composed a farm questionnaire and interviewed 10 farmers. We found that 80% of the farmers own their own farm. The largest farm is 272 acres and the smallest is 50 acres. The average size is 151 acres. 90% of the farms have some rough pasture. The amount varies from 18% to 100% of the total acreage with 60 acres being the average per farm. 80% of the farms have no employed helpers. 50% of the farms deal mostly in fat stock (both sheep and cattle ),20% in dairy cows and sheep, 20% deal almost entirely in sheep and 10% are dairy farms. All the farms keep at least some sheep. None of the farms are arable. In fact very few crops are grown and those which are, are for the farmers own use. (Continued on page 20.)
